column2: Remember to tweet your questions with #datastack to be entered into the cupcake drawing!
What would have taken months of intensive engineering efforts is now accomplished in 1,2, or 3 weeks #datastack pic.twitter.com/gZ0gmkQFUO
The 7 core challenges of data integration, brought to you by @Smcavinney #datastack pic.twitter.com/LqFOAxoBDI
How data stacks are structured today. The modeling and analytics layer removes the need for data silos #datastack pic.twitter.com/sHfv2jDenZ
Dillon from @LookerData explains the traditional (old) approach to data infrastructure #datastack pic.twitter.com/jgfxcw2tvR
The webinar is underway! Make sure you're adding #datastack to your questions to be considered for the cupcake prize!
Top project that didn't alter code was Team 3 w/Pipeline Through-Put Lite-Brite! And, finally: here's an RJ-Snuggie! pic.twitter.com/RSiviRtqbD
We're done! CEO @robertjmoore is here to remind us of our instant-runoff voting rules. I'll have results for you in ~30m. What's your vote?
Our final preso! #18 is a 1-man charity project! Using RJ's soda addiction (& some friendly competition) to benefit Ronald McDonald House?
Team 17 (my team!) started w/our Export API, but then built use-cases of automating external marketing actions w/live inputs from RJ-Reports
Team 15, TX-to-Philly import @_BobLittle made us Philly-based BBQ (RJQ) and his presentation is eating it in front of us, dish by dish.
The snuggies make you look like a wizard, but Team 14 are magicians: used Python to interpret SQL queries into human-language instructions!
Team 12 dove into the world of building automation in SalesForce to speed up Opportunity flow for our amazing Sales team. Shippable on Tues!
Team 13 (I'll come back for 12) made a line of branded RJMetrics snuggies. I'm not joking. We will locate photographic evidence of this ASAP
Team 11's preso was a bit over my head. That's 1 of many amazing things about @RJMetrics: such smart people in every room, so much to learn!
Our Median and Percentile metric types came from a past Hackathon, so we're always excited to see new measurements & perspectives show up!
Team 10, A Powered Elf Turnip, an anagram for what they built. I'll arrange a prize if you figure it out! In their spare time: Moving Avgs
What's this uncharacteristically chatty streak of tweets? We're live-tweeting our quarterly Hackathon presentations! 9 teams left to tweet.
Also, rather than present live in person, they presented in silence entirely in Slack Chat format, with ample use of /giphy (risky business)
Team 9 introduced another @SlackHQ integration! The robots are multiplying! Teaching Slack to be a personal assistant is a major theme today
Team 6 built an amazing {REDACTED}, a value-add we've frequently wished for (w/no change to codebase)! Amazing what 24hrs of effort yields.
Team 5 built a @SlackHQ integration, programming our very own JARVIS to respond to common internal questions. Less snarky than Jarvis, tho.
The implication being: we're not going to lose several dozen ping pong balls a week to the voracious couch monsters surrounding the table.
Also in Arts'n'Crafts category, Team 4 upgraded the furniture in our game room with rigid dust-ruffles. Ping Pong efficiency is popular here
Also notable, Team 3 Mike D's entire presentation is entirely drawn by hand on flip charts.
Team 3 brings RJMetrics' Pipeline into the physical world, creating a display of pipeline thru-put w/Rasp PI & LED board (think: Lite-Brite)
Team 2 is a past one-man winner, reprising a previous hit of designing new front-end visualizations, now for our data tables.
Team 1 is a one-man show re-thinking manual file upload functions in both our products. All Angular, multiple file types. Amazing 24hr work!
Welcome to the Fall 2015 RJMetrics Hackathon! I'm your host @krisis, Director of our Account Management team. So much innovation to share!
And that's a wrap. Thanks for joining us for today's webinar! Registrants: keep an eye out for a recap coming your way soon.
The personalized business cards at @RJMetrics! Yes, that is a laser shark on you see on @robertjmoore's card pic.twitter.com/O04ggDUX5T
Fun fact: there are 125 million private companies in the world #DPL15
White glove roll out allows developers to reduce potential negative impact of experimentation #DPL15

Love seeing @rjmetrics clients use the output of my work (eg visualizations) in presentations! #dpl15
.@iyengar's approach to managing inventory during the holidays: understand growth rate, identify trends, track progress #DPL15
.@jasalone sharing how @StudyMode solved the raging debate around free trials #DPL15 pic.twitter.com/AnAXuFdd7W
Final tip: metrics aren't static. Use them to understand your business, talk to investors, adjust ops #DPL15
Tips from @stephpalmeri on talking data w/ investors: Be clear about metric definition and give them access to data #DPL15
Data Point Live is...well...live! Kicking things off w/ the required embarrassing founder photo #DPL15 pic.twitter.com/sFv2OCvQta
In 2012, 120 Marketing Experiences companies were founded. Across all other categories, only 69 were founded pic.twitter.com/pTjTrszJp9
J.Haines quote related to involving methods folks in experimental design #ICBSymposium pic.twitter.com/yVIhSarJ5L
I got a Grace Hopper can coozi for programmers day @RJMetrics pic.twitter.com/XPkyPwr0Is

Our cupcake winner is @forstot! Congratulations! #MeasuringMarketingData
The Q&A period is underway! Last chance to tweet questions on #MeasuringMarketingData. Cupcake winner announced at the end.
